Posts.Content: cds wrote: I am 43.  My doctor found a pea sized lump in my breast at an annual exam on Thursday, so she referred me to mammogram and an ultrasound.  I was not that concerned because I could not feel the lump myself, and I had just had a mammogram in December.  However, I was a little curious because I had gotten called back after the mammogram in December for an additional mammogram and ultrasound after which I was assured I merely had "dense breast tissue" with areas that looked like they could be masses.  So yesterday, I expected the same conclusion -- dense breast tissue, etc.  After the mammogram and ultrasound, I was completely shocked when the doctor told me I do have a tumor and that it is "probably benign."  But she said she wants to do a biopsy on Tuesday.  I am very very upset about this.  My father died of colon cancer 20 years ago, and my mom (a non-smoker), died of lung cancer 2 years ago.  When my parents receive their diagnoses, it was totally unexpected because neither of them had cancer in their families and then they died very quickly.  My mom went from healthy to dead within 3 months.  I told my girlfriend and my sisters that I am scared and they were very dismissive -- it's nothing, don't worry, you're overreacting, etc.  Am I overreacting?  Am I stupid?  I feel stupid even posting this.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: My Loved Ones Seem Dismissive of My Anxiety cds BayouBabe

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2013 11:19AM cds wrote: Thank you so much for your kind response.  Now that you mention your reaction to your mom's situation, I very much understand others' comments.  When I took my mom to the doctor for a cough and a backache, he did a few x-rays and tests, then sent us on our way.  He called later and asked us to come in.  For some reason, I though the call back would be for reassurance and to tell us nothing was wrong.  As we waited, she told me she was scared, but I told her that I was 100% positive it was nothing and that she would owe me $100 when he confirmed that she was OK.  When the doctor called us back and said it looked like she had lung cancer that had spread to her spine, I was absolutely shocked.  I really felt horrible (and still do), for being so cavalier with her feelings.  I've never joined any forum or chat room or blog of any sort, so the fact that I've posted here is an indication of my fear.  I have a 7 year old son, and I am not so much afraid of being sick for myself (although I am afraid of that), as I am afraid of what it might do to him.  I have a sinking feeling in my stomach.  Thank you for your thoughts.  It helps!
Posts.Title: My Loved Ones Seem Dismissive of My Anxiety cds BayouBabe
